summary: A return-statement causes execution to immediately exit the invocation of a function.
details: A return-void statement can only be used in a function whose return-type is void.
If the enclosing function is a memoized-function, then memoization will occur.
static-checks: The return-type of the enclosing function must be void.
example-1: module Main in program;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    My::check(1);%0A    My::check(2);%0A    My::check(3);%0A    My::check(4);%0A    My::check(5);%0A    My::check(6);%0A    My::check(7);%0A    My::check(8);%0A    My::check(9);%0A}%0A%0Adefun check (n : int) : void%0A{%0A    if (n % 2 == 0)%0A    {%0A        return;%0A    }%0A%0A    F::println(n .. %22 is very odd.%22);%0A}
1 is very odd.%0A3 is very odd.%0A5 is very odd.%0A7 is very odd.%0A9 is very odd.
